protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.description: Refers to the threshold distance used to estimate if the areas are connected in a spatial analysis. This threshold value defines the maximum distance allowed between two spatial units for them to be considered as connected or neighboring. The unit of distance in which it is defined is explicitly specified in the unit_distance input (m or km).
protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.label: distance analysis threshold

protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.description: String that refers to the name of the column in the data_spatial_unit containing the date or time information corresponding to the spatial unit levels.
protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.label: date information column

protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.description: Represents the periods or intervals used for analysis. It specifies the length and units of time that will be considered for analyzing the data. For example, time intervals like 10Y (10 years), 5Y (5 years), 4M (4 months) can be used to define the time granularity for conducting the analysis.
protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.label: time intervals

protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.description: Refers to the starting date of the time_interval. If this value is null or not provided, the minimum date from the column_date will be automatically taken as the starting date for the analysis
protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.label: start time

protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.description: Refers to the ending date of the time_interval. If this value is null or not provided, the minimum date from the column_date will be automatically taken as the starting date for the analysis
protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.label: end time

data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|studya.description: Country in which to calculate ProtConn. Must be capitalized. List of available countries here https://geoio.biodiversite-quebec.ca/docs#/default/country_list_country_list_get.
data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|studya.label: Country

data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|studya.description: State or province in which to calculate ProtConn. List of available states/provinces here https://geoio.biodiversite-quebec.ca/docs#/default/state_list_state_list_get. If left blank, will calculate ProtConn for the whole country.
data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|studya.label: State/Province

spatial_to_DistanceMatrix>spatial_to_Dis.description: Numerical value referring to the EPSG code (European Petroleum Survey Group) associated with the spatial reference system that will be used as a reference for the study area. This numerical value specifies the projection and geodetic datum used to define the coordinates and spatial representation of the data in the study area. For further information on coordinate systems and EPSG codes, you can access the official database on the EPSG website at https://epsg.org/home.html. The website provides documentation, resources, and tools for searching and understanding the EPSG codes used in various geospatial contexts.
spatial_to_DistanceMatrix>spatial_to_Dis.label: study area EPSG

spatial_to_DistanceMatrix>spatial_to_Dis.description: String value that defines whether the user wants to use a distance matrix of centroids or the nearest edge for the ProtConn calculation
spatial_to_DistanceMatrix>spatial_to_Dis.label: type of distance matrix

spatial_to_DistanceMatrix>spatial_to_Dis.description: String value that defines the measurement unit for calculating distances between spatial units (m or km) and estimating their areas (m2 or km2) in the study area.
spatial_to_DistanceMatrix>spatial_to_Dis.label: unit for distance measurement

spatial_to_DistanceMatrix>spatial_to_Dis.description: String that refers to the name of the column in the spatial file with the levels used to define the spatial units. In cases where there are multiple polygons per level, they will be grouped together, and the attributes of the first listed polygon will be taken into account.
spatial_to_DistanceMatrix>spatial_to_Dis.label: name of grouping attribute

data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|transb.description: Distance (in meters) beyond the boundary of the study area to be included in the ProtConn index. Protected areas within this distance of the edge of the study area will be included in the calculation of ProtConn. A transboundary distance of 0 will only include protected areas in the study area.
data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|transb.label: Transboundary distance

data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|studya.description: File path of the study area of interest (leave blank if using data from WDPA)
data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|studya.label: Study area file

data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|protec.description: File path of the shapefile of protected areas (Leave blank if using data from WDPA)
data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|protec.label: Protected areas file

protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.description: Contains the results of the connectivity analysis between the spatial units within the study area. This table provides valuable information about the spatial relationships and connectivity patterns among different spatial entities
protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.label: Protcon results

data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|study_.description: Represents the map of the study area
data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|study_.label: Polygon of study area

data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|protec.description: Represents the map of the protected areas within the study area
data>getProtectedAreasWDPA.yml@48|protec.label: Polygon of protected areas

protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.description: percentage of total area that is protected and percentage of protected area that is connected
protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.label: protcon results in a pie chart

protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.description: Contains the result of the connectivity analysis with 3 preset thresholds of 1, 10, and 100km that cover most of the common dispersal distances
protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.label: protcon result with recommended preset thresholds

protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.description: percentage of total area that is protected and percentage of protected area that is connected with 3 preset distances
protcon_analysis>protcon_analysis.yml@41.label: protcon results in a pie chart
